ygData.subject: Re: [rest-discuss] Re: ETag and PUT

Subject: Re: [rest-discuss] Re: ETag and PUT

Hi Roy,

On Jan 22, 2007, at 3:59 PM, Roy T. Fielding wrote:

> On Jan 22, 2007, at 2:59 PM, Alan Dean wrote:
>> I have to admit it seems odd to send an ETag along with a response
>> marked no-cache, but it is permitted by the spec if you wish to do  
>> so.
>
> ETag is not an entity-header. ETag provides information about the
> resource, not the current message, so it is orthogonal to cache
> control.
>
Hmm. How else might an ETag be used other than determining if a  
cached entity is still current?

Bill
----
Bill Venners
President
Artima, Inc.
